en.label: Orlanthi Calendar (Glorantha)
en.description: Standard Gloranthan calendar used by the Orlanthi and many other cultures. Divides the 294-day year into five 8-week seasons followed by a two-week Sacred Time.

months.name: Sea Season
months.description: The season of growth and trade.

months.name: Fire Season
months.description: The warm season of conflict and campaigning.

months.name: Dark Season
months.description: The cold, dangerous season when spirits walk.

months.name: Storm Season
months.description: The tempestuous season of winter gales.

months.name: Sacred Time
months.description: Two weeks of rituals marking year's end and renewal.

weekdays.name: Freezeday
weekdays.description: First day dedicated to air and cold.

weekdays.name: Waterday
weekdays.description: Second day honoring water and rivers.

weekdays.name: Clayday
weekdays.description: Third day of earth and craft.

weekdays.name: Windsday
weekdays.description: Fourth day for storms and change.

weekdays.name: Fireday
weekdays.description: Fifth day celebrating flame and light.

weekdays.name: Wildday
weekdays.description: Sixth day tied to beasts and the untamed.
